p: The addition of antimicrobial and antioxidant agents to the edible coatings and films is beneficial compared to their direct application to food products due to providing the opportunity of gradually releasing the agents and maintaining a critical concentration for a prolonged period [ 26, 71, 98, 99]. In contrast with the migration of antimicrobials from the coating, the direct addition of antimicrobials to food will cause immediate microbial inhibition while the recovery of the injured cells and the later growth of the undestroyed cells may cause quality losses and/or foodborne diseases [ 100].
